text:
Hello, I added extra fields to my blog template like this

`{% text "blog_custom_cat" label="Enter custom category here", value="" %}`

Is it possible to make a repeater field from this?
To my knowledge, you're stuck with having to write a script.

Hello everyone. I wanted to share a script you can use if you are using content staging to change the header nav links to staging domain. This prevents testers clicking the links and then navigating to the live site and getting confused. I also added a "staging" tag in the top left corner so it is obvious you are on a staging environment instead of the live site. <https://bootstrapcreative.com/how-to-update-navigation-menu-in-HubSpot-content-staging/>

I also wanted to share a HubSpot developer cheat sheet I created to quickly find documentation. I found the default search hard to use and loads a bit slow for me. So I use this page and do a quick search and then navigate to the right place in the docs: <https://bootstrapcreative.com/resources/HubSpot-hubl-docs-cheat-sheet/>
Can you share your code with me in DM?

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/design-manager/a-quick-tour-of-the-design-manager>
is the layout editor available only with a subscription? or was the feature removed? I can't find it at all.
That was how templates where made years ago, I highly avoid using that features and work with themes instead

alright, thanks!
wiki could use some updates then .

HubSpot Product Manager here! Sounds like our Conversations API might have what you are looking for.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations>

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hi Everyone. Hoping to get a little help with a custom property. I'll be as brief as possible. I'm using a 3rd party form (Formcrafts) and integrating with HS using api.hsforms. The issue I'm having is that I am passing an image URL over to a ticket property (single-line text), but the client needs that to be formatted as a link. Is it possible to do so? I was hoping to be able to use a rich-text property and pass in html anchor link in the JSON object, but you can't put rich-text fields on forms, so that's a no go. If anyone has any thoughts I'd really appreciate it! Thanks!

Morning, HubSpot Devs! Is anyone experienced with <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|Custom Workflow Actions>, specifically their `outputFields`? I'm struggling to get outputs to work. Details in thread.
